intro: Lachenalia pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf lachenalia, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces delicate, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ease of cultivation, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
